docs.snippet: Another day of runway looks, another Scorecard at your service....
docs.lead_paragraph: When "sexy" is the root of the compound modifiers - "supremely sexy," "Versace-sexy" - used most in the reviews, then you know Scorecard is really in Milan. On the third day of shows, which saw Dubai-based financial backers bring Gianfranco Ferré back from the brink, Rossella Jardini dialed Moschino's surreal provocation way back. Donatella Versace, meanwhile, went for a somewhat discreet vision of Gianni-baroque, proving the old adage to make new friends, but keep the old.
docs.abstract: Another day of runway looks, another Scorecard at your service.

docs.snippet: The singer Maluca Mala on her struggles as an independent singer and of her upcoming Dominican Independence Day performance on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two years ago, Nathalie Yepez - a 29-year-old first generation New Yorker who was born to Dominican parents in the Bronx and grew up in Washington Heights and the East Village - moved back to her mother's house, quit her bartending and waitressing jobs to pursue music full time, and reinvented herself as the singer Maluca Mala. "I thought to myself, Enough is enough!" she recalls. "I'm miserable sitting at home writing music and just talking about it." Mala, who not surprisingly identifies as a "hood hipster," performs a mix of what she calls "ghetto-techno, Latin-dance, hip-hop, rave music." It's a decadent mix that has not gone unnoticed - especially by Lady Gaga, whose beer-cans-as-rollers look in the video for "Telephone" appears to have been inspired by Mala's headgear in her video for "El Tigeraso."
docs.abstract: The singer Maluca Mala on her struggles as an independent singer and of her upcoming Dominican Independence Day performance on Sunday.

docs.snippet: The controversial director saw his movie "The Ghost Writer" take four awards at the French equivalent of the Oscars, though it didn't win the top prize....
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS- Roman Polanski, the 77-year-old director whose film "The Ghost Writer" was snubbed by the Oscars, won a measure of solace on Friday when the French cultural elite showered the thriller with four Césars. The honors (France's version of the Academy Awards) included a best directing nod for Mr. Polanski, who was vigorously supported by French film and political celebrities when he was arrested in September 2009 on a more than 30-year-old sex crime warrant from the United States and jailed and detained in Switzerland until he successfully fended off extradition last July.
docs.abstract: The controversial director saw his movie "The Ghost Writer" take four awards at the French equivalent of the Oscars, though it didn't win the top prize.

headline.main: Polanski Basks in Applause at César Awards

docs.snippet: SALTZMAN--Lawrence, 89, of Pompton Plains, NJ, died on February 23, 2011 after a long illness. Born in Brooklyn to Samuel and Celia (Sipowitz) Saltzman, Larry graduated from Brooklyn College with a degree in economics. He served with distinction i...
docs.lead_paragraph: SALTZMAN--Lawrence, 89, of Pompton Plains, NJ, died on February 23, 2011 after a long illness. Born in Brooklyn to Samuel and Celia (Sipowitz) Saltzman, Larry graduated from Brooklyn College with a degree in economics. He served with distinction in the U.S. Army in WWII, attaining the rank of First Lieutenant. Larry enjoyed a long career in the hosiery and ready to wear businesses, rising from salesman to become President of Round-the-Clock Hosiery, a division of International Playtex. An avid boater and fisherman, he retired to Longboat Key, Florida, serving as president of his condominium association for many years. He was also a voracious reader and a longtime member of a Great Books discussion group. In addition to his wife of 60 years, Anita, he is survived by his son and daughter-in-law Edward and Mary Saltzman of New Vernon, NJ, daughter and son-in-law Emily and Stuart Rosen of Avon, CT, grandchildren Jeffrey and Leah Rosen and Madeleine Saltzman, brother and sister-in-law Dr. Marvin and Sylvia Saltzman of Plainville, CT. He was predeceased by his sister and brother-in-law Enid (Saltzman) and Oscar Fienberg. Donations may be made to Iraq/Afghanistan war veterans, www.iava.org, or to the charity of your choosing.
